60   | /* Prototypes and such */
61   | #define __FORTIFY_C__
62   | 
63   | #if defined(USE_FAST_CKSUM)
64   |   #undef  FORTIFY_CHECKSUM_VALUE
65   |   #define FORTIFY_CHECKSUM_VALUE 0xFFFF
66   | #endif
67   | 
68   | #include "fortify.h"
69   | #include "chksum.h"
70   | 
71   | #if defined(USE_FORTIFY) || defined(USE_BSD_FORTIFY)
72   | 
73   | 
74   | #define STATIC
75   | 
76   | /*
77   |  * struct Header - this structure is used 
78   |  * internally by Fortify to manage it's 
79   |  * own private lists of memory.
80   |  */
81   | struct Header {
82   |        WORD           Checksum;     /* For the integrity of our goodies  */
83   |        const char    *File;         /* The sourcefile of the allocator   */
84   |        DWORD          Line;         /* The sourceline of the allocator   */
85   | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
86   |        const char    *FreedFile;    /* The sourcefile of the deallocator */
87   |        DWORD          FreedLine;    /* The sourceline of the deallocator */
88   |        BYTE           Deallocator;  /* The deallocator used              */
89   | #endif
90   |        size_t         Size;         /* The size of the malloc'd block    */
91   |        struct Header *Prev;         /* Previous link                     */
92   |        struct Header *Next;         /* Next link                         */
93   |        char          *Label;        /* User's Label (may be null)        */
94   |        BYTE           Scope;        /* Scope level of the caller         */
95   |        BYTE           Allocator;    /* malloc/realloc/new/etc            */
96   |      };
97   | 
98   | /*
99   |  * Round x up to the nearest multiple of n.
100  |  */
101  | #define ROUND_UP(x,n)        ((((x) + (n)-1)/(n))*(n))
102  | 
103  | #define FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE  ROUND_UP(sizeof(struct Header), sizeof(WORD))
104  | 
105  | /*
106  |  * FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE is FORTIFY_BEFORE_SIZE rounded up to the
107  |  * next multiple of FORTIFY_ALIGNMENT. This is so that we can guarantee
108  |  * the alignment of user memory for such systems where this is important
109  |  * (eg storing doubles on a SPARC)
110  |  */
111  | #define FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE ( \
112  |         ROUND_UP (FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE+FORTIFY_BEFORE_SIZE, FORTIFY_ALIGNMENT) \
113  |         - FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE)
114  | 
115  | /*
116  |  * FORTIFY_OVERHEAD is the total overhead added by Fortify to each
117  |  * memory block.
118  |  */
119  | #define FORTIFY_OVERHEAD (FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE         + \
120  |                           FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + \
121  |                           FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE)
122  | 
123  | 
124  | /*
125  |  * Static Function Prototypes
126  |  */
127  | STATIC int  st_CheckBlock         (struct Header *h, const char *file, DWORD line);
128  | STATIC int  st_CheckFortification (BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size);
129  | STATIC void st_SetFortification   (BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size);
130  | STATIC void st_OutputFortification(BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size);
131  | STATIC void st_HexDump            (BYTE *ptr, size_t offset, size_t size, int title);
132  | STATIC int  st_IsHeaderValid      (struct Header *h);
133  | STATIC void st_MakeHeaderValid    (struct Header *h);
134  | STATIC WORD st_ChecksumHeader     (struct Header *h);
135  | STATIC int  st_IsOnAllocatedList  (struct Header *h);
136  | STATIC void st_OutputHeader       (struct Header *h);
137  | STATIC void st_OutputMemory       (struct Header *h);
138  | STATIC void st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint(void);
139  | STATIC void st_DefaultOutput      (const char *String);
140  | STATIC const char *st_MemoryBlockString(struct Header *h);
141  | STATIC void st_OutputDeleteTrace (void);
142  | 
143  | #if defined (FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY)
144  | #if defined (FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY) && \
145  |     defined (FORTIFY_VERBOSE_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY)
146  |     STATIC const char *st_DeallocatedMemoryBlockString(struct Header *h);
147  | #endif
148  |     STATIC int st_IsOnDeallocatedList(struct Header *h);
149  |     STATIC int st_PurgeDeallocatedBlocks(DWORD Bytes, const char *file, DWORD line);
150  |     STATIC int st_PurgeDeallocatedScope(BYTE Scope, const char *file, DWORD line);
151  |     STATIC int st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(struct Header *h, const char *file, DWORD line);
152  |     STATIC void st_FreeDeallocatedBlock(struct Header *h, const char *file, DWORD line);
153  | #endif
154  | 
155  | 
156  | /*
157  |  * Static variables
158  |  */
159  | STATIC char                  st_Buffer[4096]     = { 0 }; /* don't use BSS */
160  | STATIC struct Header        *st_AllocatedHead    = 0;
161  | STATIC int                   st_AllocateFailRate = 0;
162  | STATIC Fortify_OutputFuncPtr st_Output           = st_DefaultOutput;
163  | STATIC const char           *st_LastVerifiedFile = "unknown";
164  | STATIC DWORD                 st_LastVerifiedLine = 0;
165  | STATIC BYTE                  st_Scope            = 0;
166  | STATIC BYTE                  st_Disabled         = 0;
167  | 
168  | #if defined(__HIGHC__) && 0 // !! not yet
169  | STATIC char st_LockDataStart = 0;
170  | #endif
171  | 
172  | #ifdef __cplusplus
173  |   int    gbl_FortifyMagic = 0;
174  |   STATIC const char *st_DeleteFile[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE];
175  |   STATIC DWORD       st_DeleteLine[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE];
176  |   STATIC DWORD       st_DeleteStackTop;
177  | #endif
178  | 
179  | /* statistics */
180  | STATIC DWORD  st_MaxBlocks        = 0;
181  | STATIC DWORD  st_MaxAllocation    = 0;
182  | STATIC DWORD  st_CurBlocks        = 0;
183  | STATIC DWORD  st_CurAllocation    = 0;
184  | STATIC DWORD  st_Allocations      = 0;
185  | STATIC DWORD  st_Frees            = 0;
186  | STATIC DWORD  st_TotalAllocation  = 0;
187  | STATIC DWORD  st_AllocationLimit  = 0xffffffff;
188  | 
189  | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
190  |   STATIC struct Header *st_DeallocatedHead  = 0;
191  |   STATIC struct Header *st_DeallocatedTail  = 0;
192  |   STATIC DWORD          st_TotalDeallocated = 0;
193  | #endif
194  | 
195  |  
196  | /* allocators */
197  | STATIC const char *st_AllocatorName[] = {
198  |                   "malloc()",
199  |                   "calloc()",
200  |                   "realloc()",
201  |                   "strdup()",
202  |                   "new",
203  |                   "new[]"
204  |                 };
205  | 
206  | /* deallocators */
207  | STATIC const char *st_DeallocatorName[] = {
208  |                   "nobody",
209  |                   "free()",
210  |                   "realloc()",
211  |                   "delete",
212  |                   "delete[]"
213  |                 };
214  | 
215  | STATIC const BYTE st_ValidDeallocator[] = {
216  |     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_free) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_realloc),
217  |     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_free) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_realloc),
218  |     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_free) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_realloc),
219  |     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_free) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_realloc),
220  | #if defined(FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_NEW) && defined(FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_DELETE)
221  |     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_delete),
222  |     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_array_delete)
223  | #else
224  |     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_delete) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_array_delete),
225  |     (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_delete) | (1 << Fortify_Deallocator_array_delete)
226  | #endif
227  | };
228  | 
229  | STATIC char st_LockDataFill[4096] = { 0 };
230  | STATIC char st_LockDataEnd        = 0;
231  | 
232  | 
233  | #if defined(__HIGHC__) && 0 // !! not yet
234  | 
235  | #include <pharlap.h>
236  | #include <hw386.h>
237  | 
238  | /*
239  |  *  Change page-attributes for local data.
240  |  *  Set to present or non-present pages.
241  |  */
242  | STATIC Fortify_LockLocalData (int lock)
243  | {
244  |   UINT  lockSize  = (ULONG)&st_LockDataEnd - (ULONG)&st_LockDataStart;
245  |   ULONG num_pages = (lockSize + 4095) / 4096;
246  |   ULONG page      = ((ULONG)&st_LockDataStart + 4095) / 4096;
247  | 
248  |   for ( ; page < page + num_pages; page++)
249  |   {
250  |     ULONG pte, ptInfo;
251  |     if (_dx_rd_ptinfl (page << 12, &pte, &ptInfo))
252  |        break;
253  |     if (lock)
254  |          pte &= ~PE_PRESENT;
255  |     else pte |=  PE_PRESENT;
256  |     if (_dx_wr_ptinfl (page << 12, pte, ptInfo))
257  |        break;
258  |   }
259  | }
260  | #endif
261  | 
262  | 
263  | /*
264  |  * Fortify_Allocate() - allocate a block of fortified memory
265  |  */
266  | void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
267  | Fortify_Allocate (size_t size, BYTE allocator, const char *file, DWORD line)
268  | {
269  |   struct Header *h;
270  |   int    another_try;
271  |   BYTE  *ptr = NULL;
272  | 
273  |   /*
274  |    * If Fortify has been disabled, then it's easy
275  |    */
276  |   if (st_Disabled)
277  |   {
278  | #ifdef FORTIFY_FAIL_ON_ZERO_MALLOC
279  |     if (size == 0 &&
280  |         (allocator == Fortify_Allocator_new ||
281  |          allocator == Fortify_Allocator_array_new))
282  |     {
283  |       /*
284  |        * A new of zero bytes must succeed, but a malloc of
285  |        * zero bytes probably won't
286  |        */
287  |       return malloc(1);
288  |     }
289  | #endif
290  | 
291  |     return malloc(size);
292  |   }
293  | 
294  | #ifdef FORTIFY_CHECK_ALL_MEMORY_ON_ALLOCATE
295  |   Fortify_CheckAllMemory (file, line);
296  | #endif  
297  | 
298  |   if (st_AllocateFailRate > 0)
299  |   {
300  |     if (rand() % 100 < st_AllocateFailRate)
301  |     {
302  | #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_FALSE_FAIL
303  |       sprintf (st_Buffer,
304  |                "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes \"false failed\" at %s.%lu\n",
305  |                st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size, file, line);
306  |       st_Output (st_Buffer);
307  | #endif
308  |       return (0);
309  |     }
310  |   }
311  | 
312  |   /* Check to see if this allocation will
313  |    * push us over the artificial limit
314  |    */
315  |   if (st_CurAllocation + size > st_AllocationLimit)
316  |   {
317  | #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_FALSE_FAIL
318  |     sprintf (st_Buffer,
319  |              "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes \"false failed\" at %s.%lu\n",
320  |              st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size, file, line);
321  |     st_Output (st_Buffer);
322  | #endif
323  |     return (0);
324  |   }
325  | 
326  | #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ZERO_MALLOC
327  |   if (size == 0 && (allocator == Fortify_Allocator_malloc ||
328  |                     allocator == Fortify_Allocator_calloc ||
329  |                     allocator == Fortify_Allocator_realloc))
330  |   {
331  |     sprintf(st_Buffer,
332  |             "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of 0 bytes attempted at %s.%lu\n",
333  |             st_AllocatorName[allocator], file, line);
334  |     st_Output(st_Buffer);
335  |   }
336  | #endif /* FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ZERO_MALLOC */
337  | 
338  | #ifdef FORTIFY_FAIL_ON_ZERO_MALLOC
339  |   if (size == 0 && (allocator == Fortify_Allocator_malloc ||
340  |                     allocator == Fortify_Allocator_calloc ||
341  |                     allocator == Fortify_Allocator_realloc))
342  |   {
343  | #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ALLOCATE_FAIL
344  |     sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes failed at %s.%lu\n",
345  |             st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size, file, line);
346  |     st_Output(st_Buffer);
347  | #endif /* FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ALLOCATE_FAIL */
348  |     return (0);
349  |   }
350  | #endif /* FORTIFY_FAIL_ON_ZERO_MALLOC */    
351  | 
352  | #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_SIZE_T_OVERFLOW
353  |     /*
354  |      * Ensure the size of the memory block
355  |      * plus the overhead isn't bigger than
356  |      * size_t (that'd be a drag)
357  |      */
358  |     {
359  |         size_t private_size = FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE
360  |                             + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + size + FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE;
361  | 
362  |         if (private_size < size)
363  |         {
364  |             sprintf(st_Buffer, 
365  |                     "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes has overflowed size_t at %s.%lu\n",
366  |                     st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size, file, line);
367  |             st_Output(st_Buffer);
368  |             return (0);
369  |         }
370  | #if (DOSX) && defined(__WATCOMC__) && 0
371  |         if (private_size >= 65536UL)
372  |         {
373  |             sprintf(st_Buffer, 
374  |                     "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes has exceeded 64kB limit by %d bytes, at %s.%lu\n",
375  |                     st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size,
376  |                     private_size - size, file, line);
377  |             st_Output(st_Buffer);
378  |             return (0);
379  |         }
380  | #endif
381  |     }
382  | #endif                              
383  | 
384  |     another_try = 1;
385  |     do
386  |     {
387  |         /*
388  |          * malloc the memory, including the space 
389  |          * for the header and fortification buffers
390  |          */  
391  |         ptr = (BYTE *)malloc ( FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE
392  |                                    + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE
393  |                                    + size
394  |                                    + FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
395  | 
396  | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
397  |         /*
398  |          * If we're tracking deallocated memory, then
399  |          * we can free some of it, rather than let
400  |          * this malloc fail
401  |          */
402  |         if (!ptr)
403  |            another_try = st_PurgeDeallocatedBlocks(size, file, line);
404  | 
405  | #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
406  | 
407  |     }
408  |     while (!ptr && another_try);
409  | 
410  |     if (!ptr)
411  |     {
412  | #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_ON_ALLOCATE_FAIL
413  |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: A \"%s\" of %lu bytes failed at %s.%lu\n",
414  |                 st_AllocatorName[allocator], (DWORD)size, file, line);
415  |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
416  | #endif
417  |         return (0);
418  |     }
419  | 
420  |     /*
421  |      * Begin Critical Region
422  |      */
423  |     FORTIFY_LOCK();
424  | 
425  | 
426  |     /* 
427  |      * Make the head's prev pointer point to us
428  |      * ('cos we're about to become the head)
429  |      */
430  |     if (st_AllocatedHead)
431  |     {
432  |         st_CheckBlock(st_AllocatedHead, file, line);
433  |         /* what should we do if this fails? (apart from panic) */
434  | 
435  |         st_AllocatedHead->Prev = (struct Header *)ptr;
436  |         st_MakeHeaderValid(st_AllocatedHead);  
437  |     }
438  | 
439  |     /*
440  |      * Initialize and validate the header
441  |      */
442  |     h = (struct Header *)ptr;
443  |     h->Size      = size;
444  |     h->File      = file;
445  |     h->Line      = line;  
446  |     h->Next      = st_AllocatedHead;
447  |     h->Prev      = 0;
448  |     h->Scope     = st_Scope;
449  |     h->Allocator = allocator;
450  |     h->Label     = 0;
451  | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
452  |     h->FreedFile = 0;
453  |     h->FreedLine = 0;
454  |     h->Deallocator = Fortify_Deallocator_nobody;
455  | #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
456  |     st_MakeHeaderValid(h);
457  |     st_AllocatedHead = h;
458  |   
459  |     /*
460  |      * Initialize the fortifications
461  |      */    
462  |     st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE,
463  |                      FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
464  |     st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + size,
465  |                      FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
466  | 
467  | #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_ALLOCATE
468  |     /*
469  |      * Fill the actual user memory
470  |      */
471  |     st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
472  |                         FORTIFY_FILL_ON_ALLOCATE_VALUE, size);
473  | #endif
474  | 
475  |     /*
476  |      * End Critical Region
477  |      */
478  |     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
479  | 
480  | 
481  |     /*
482  |      * update the statistics
483  |      */
484  |     st_TotalAllocation += size;
485  |     st_Allocations++;
486  |     st_CurBlocks++;
487  |     st_CurAllocation += size;
488  |     if (st_CurBlocks > st_MaxBlocks)
489  |         st_MaxBlocks = st_CurBlocks;
490  |     if (st_CurAllocation > st_MaxAllocation)
491  |         st_MaxAllocation = st_CurAllocation;
492  | 
493  |     /*
494  |      * We return the address of the user's memory, not the start of the block,
495  |      * which points to our magic cookies
496  |      */
497  |     return (ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
498  | }
499  | 
500  | 
501  | 
502  | /*
503  |  * Fortify_Deallocate() - Free a block of memory allocated with Fortify_Allocate()
504  |  */
505  | void FORTIFY_STORAGE
506  | Fortify_Deallocate(void *uptr, BYTE deallocator, const char *file, DWORD line)
507  | {
508  |     BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)uptr
509  |                         - FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE
510  |                         - FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE;
511  |     struct Header *h   = (struct Header *)ptr;
512  | 
513  | #ifdef FORTIFY_CHECK_ALL_MEMORY_ON_DEALLOCATE
514  |     Fortify_CheckAllMemory(file, line);
515  | #endif
516  | 
517  |     /*
518  |      * If Fortify has been disabled, then it's easy
519  |      * (well, almost)
520  |      */
521  |     if (st_Disabled)
522  |     {
523  |         /* there is a possibility that this memory
524  |          * block was allocated when Fortify was
525  |          * enabled, so we must check the Allocated
526  |          * list before we free it.
527  |          */
528  |         if (!st_IsOnAllocatedList(h))
529  |         {
530  |             free(uptr);    
531  |             return;
532  |         }    
533  |         else
534  |         {
535  |             /* the block was allocated by Fortify, so we 
536  |              * gotta free it differently.
537  |              */
538  |             /*
539  |              * Begin critical region
540  |              */
541  |             FORTIFY_LOCK();
542  |         
543  |             /*
544  |              * Remove the block from the list
545  |              */
546  |             if (h->Prev)
547  |                 h->Prev->Next = h->Next;
548  |             else
549  |                 st_AllocatedHead = h->Next;
550  |         
551  |             if (h->Next)
552  |                 h->Next->Prev = h->Prev;
553  |         
554  |             /*
555  |              * End Critical Region
556  |              */
557  |             FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
558  | 
559  |             /*
560  |              * actually free the memory
561  |              */
562  |             free(ptr);
563  |             return;
564  |         }
565  |     }
566  | 
567  | 
568  | #ifdef FORTIFY_PARANOID_DEALLOCATE
569  |     if (!st_IsOnAllocatedList(h))
570  |     {
571  | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
572  |         if (st_IsOnDeallocatedList(h))
573  |         {
574  |             sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: \"%s\" twice of %s detected at %s.%lu\n",
575  |                                 st_DeallocatorName[deallocator],
576  |                                 st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
577  |             st_Output(st_Buffer);
578  | 
579  |             sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
580  |                                 st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
581  |             st_Output(st_Buffer);
582  |             st_OutputDeleteTrace();
583  |             return;
584  |         }
585  | #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
586  | 
587  |         sprintf (st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Possible \"%s\" twice of (%08lX) was detected at %s.%lu\n",
588  |                  st_DeallocatorName[deallocator], (DWORD)uptr, file, line);
589  | 
590  |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
591  |         st_OutputDeleteTrace();
592  |         return;
593  |     }
594  | #endif /* FORTIFY_PARANOID_DELETE */
595  | 
596  |     /*
597  |      * Make sure the block is okay before we free it.
598  |      * If it's not okay, don't free it - it might not
599  |      * be a real memory block. Or worse still, someone
600  |      * might still be writing to it
601  |      */
602  |     if (!st_CheckBlock(h, file, line))
603  |     {
604  |         st_OutputDeleteTrace();
605  |         return;
606  |     }
607  | 
608  | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
609  |     /*
610  |      * Make sure the block hasn't been freed already
611  |      * (we can get to here if FORTIFY_PARANOID_DELETE
612  |      * is off, but FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
613  |      * is on).
614  |      */
615  |     if (h->Deallocator != Fortify_Deallocator_nobody)
616  |     {
617  |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: \"%s\" twice of %s detected at %s.%lu\n",
618  |                               st_DeallocatorName[deallocator],
619  |                             st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
620  |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
621  | 
622  |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
623  |                             st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
624  |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
625  |         st_OutputDeleteTrace();
626  |         return;
627  |     }
628  | #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
629  | 
630  |     /*
631  |      * Make sure the block is being freed with a valid
632  |      * deallocator. If not, complain. (but free it anyway)
633  |      */
634  |     if ((st_ValidDeallocator[h->Allocator] & (1 << deallocator)) == 0)
635  |     {
636  |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Incorrect deallocator \"%s\" detected at %s.%lu\n",
637  |                               st_DeallocatorName[deallocator], file, line);
638  |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
639  |         sprintf(st_Buffer,   "         %s was allocated with \"%s\"\n",
640  |                               st_MemoryBlockString(h), st_AllocatorName[h->Allocator]);
641  |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
642  |         st_OutputDeleteTrace();
643  |     }
644  | 
645  |     /*
646  |      * Begin critical region
647  |      */
648  |     FORTIFY_LOCK();
649  | 
650  |     /*
651  |      * Remove the block from the list
652  |      */
653  |     if (h->Prev)
654  |     {
655  |         if (!st_CheckBlock(h->Prev, file, line))
656  |         {
657  |             FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
658  |             st_OutputDeleteTrace();
659  |             return;
660  |         }
661  | 
662  |         h->Prev->Next = h->Next;
663  |         st_MakeHeaderValid(h->Prev);
664  |     }
665  |     else
666  |         st_AllocatedHead = h->Next;
667  | 
668  |     if (h->Next)
669  |     {
670  |         if (!st_CheckBlock(h->Next, file, line))
671  |         {
672  |             FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
673  |             st_OutputDeleteTrace();
674  |             return;
675  |         }
676  | 
677  |         h->Next->Prev = h->Prev;
678  |         st_MakeHeaderValid(h->Next);
679  |     }
680  | 
681  |     /*
682  |      * End Critical Region
683  |      */
684  |     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
685  | 
686  |     /*
687  |      * update the statistics
688  |      */
689  |     st_Frees++;
690  |     st_CurBlocks--;
691  |     st_CurAllocation -= h->Size;
692  | 
693  | 
694  | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
695  |     if (st_Scope > 0)
696  |     {
697  |         /*
698  |          * Don't _actually_ free the memory block, just yet.
699  |          * Place it onto the deallocated list, instead, so
700  |          * we can check later to see if it's been written to.
701  |          */
702  |     #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE
703  |         /*
704  |          * Nuke out all user memory that is about to be freed
705  |          */
706  |         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
707  |                                     FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE,
708  |                                   h->Size);
709  |     #endif /* FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE */
710  | 
711  |         /*
712  |          * Begin critical region
713  |          */
714  |         FORTIFY_LOCK();
715  | 
716  |         /*
717  |          * Place the block on the deallocated list
718  |          */
719  |         if (st_DeallocatedHead)
720  |         {
721  |             st_DeallocatedHead->Prev = (struct Header *)ptr;
722  |             st_MakeHeaderValid(st_DeallocatedHead);
723  |         }
724  | 
725  |         h = (struct Header *)ptr;
726  |         h->FreedFile   = file;
727  |         h->FreedLine   = line;
728  |         h->Deallocator = deallocator;
729  |         h->Next        = st_DeallocatedHead;
730  |         h->Prev        = 0;
731  |         st_MakeHeaderValid(h);
732  |         st_DeallocatedHead = h;
733  | 
734  |         if (!st_DeallocatedTail)
735  |         {
736  |             st_DeallocatedTail = h;
737  |         }
738  | 
739  |         st_TotalDeallocated += h->Size;
740  | 
741  |     #ifdef FORTIFY_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY_LIMIT
742  |         /*
743  |          * If we've got too much on the deallocated list; free some
744  |          */
745  |         if (st_TotalDeallocated > FORTIFY_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY_LIMIT)
746  |         {
747  |              st_PurgeDeallocatedBlocks(st_TotalDeallocated - FORTIFY_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY_LIMIT, file, line);
748  |         }
749  |     #endif
750  | 
751  |         /*
752  |          * End critical region
753  |          */
754  |         FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
755  |     }
756  |     else
757  | #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
758  |     {
759  |            /*
760  |          * Free the User Label
761  |          */
762  |         if (h->Label)
763  |         {
764  |             free(h->Label);
765  |         }             
766  | 
767  | #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE
768  |         /*
769  |          * Nuke out all memory that is about to be freed, including the header
770  |          */
771  |         st_SetFortification(ptr, FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE,
772  |                               FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size + FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
773  | #endif /* FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE */
774  | 
775  |         /*
776  |          * And do the actual free
777  |          */
778  |         free(ptr);
779  |     }
780  | }
781  | 
782  | 
783  | /*
784  |  * Fortify_LabelPointer() - Labels the memory block
785  |  * with a string provided by the user. This function
786  |  * takes a copy of the passed in string.
787  |  * The pointer MUST be one returned by a Fortify
788  |  * allocation function.
789  |  */
790  | void
791  | Fortify_LabelPointer(void *uptr, const char *label, const char *file, DWORD line)
792  | {
793  |     if (!st_Disabled)
794  |     {
795  |         BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)uptr
796  |                               - FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE - FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE;
797  |         struct Header *h = (struct Header *)ptr;
798  | 
799  |         /* make sure the pointer is okay */
800  |         Fortify_CheckPointer(uptr, file, line);
801  |     
802  |         /* free the previous label */
803  |         if (h->Label)
804  |         {
805  |             free(h->Label);
806  |         }    
807  |     
808  |         /* make sure the label is sensible */
809  |         assert(label);
810  | 
811  |         /* copy it in */
812  |         h->Label = (char*)malloc(strlen(label)+1);
813  |         strcpy(h->Label, label);
814  |         
815  |         /* update the checksum */
816  |         st_MakeHeaderValid(h);
817  |     }
818  | }
819  | 
820  | /*
821  |  * Fortify_CheckPointer() - Returns true if the uptr
822  |  * points to a valid piece of Fortify_Allocated()'d
823  |  * memory. The memory must be on the allocated list,
824  |  * and it's fortifications must be intact.
825  |  * Always returns TRUE if Fortify is disabled.
826  |  */
827  | int FORTIFY_STORAGE
828  | Fortify_CheckPointer(void *uptr, const char *file, DWORD line)
829  | {
830  |     BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)uptr
831  |                               - FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE - FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE;
832  |     struct Header *h = (struct Header *)ptr;
833  |     int r;
834  | 
835  |     if (st_Disabled)
836  |         return 1;
837  | 
838  |     FORTIFY_LOCK();
839  | 
840  |     if (!st_IsOnAllocatedList(h))
841  |     {
842  |         sprintf (st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Invalid pointer (%08lX) detected at %s.%lu\n",
843  |                  (DWORD) uptr, file, line);
844  | 
845  |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
846  |         FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
847  |         return (0);
848  |     }
849  | 
850  | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
851  |     if (st_IsOnDeallocatedList(h))
852  |     {
853  |         sprintf (st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Deallocated pointer (%08lX) detected at %s.%lu\n",
854  |                  (DWORD) uptr, file, line);
855  | 
856  |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
857  |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
858  |                            st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
859  |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
860  |         FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
861  |         return (0);
862  |     }
863  | #endif
864  | 
865  |     r = st_CheckBlock(h, file, line);
866  |     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
867  |     return r;
868  | }
869  | 
870  | /*
871  |  * Fortify_SetOutputFunc(Fortify_OutputFuncPtr Output) -
872  |  * Sets the function used to output all error and
873  |  * diagnostic messages. The output function  takes 
874  |  * a single const BYTE * argument, and must be
875  |  * able to handle newlines. This function returns the 
876  |  * old output function.
877  |  */
878  | Fortify_OutputFuncPtr FORTIFY_STORAGE
879  | Fortify_SetOutputFunc(Fortify_OutputFuncPtr Output)
880  | {
881  |     Fortify_OutputFuncPtr Old = st_Output;
882  | 
883  |     st_Output = Output;
884  |   
885  |     return (Old);
886  | }
887  | 
888  | /*
889  |  * Fortify_SetAllocateFailRate(int Percent) - 
890  |  * Fortify_Allocate() will "fail" this Percent of 
891  |  * the time, even if the memory is available. 
892  |  * Useful to "stress-test" an application. 
893  |  * Returns the old value.
894  |  * The fail rate defaults to 0 (a good default I think).
895  |  */
896  | int FORTIFY_STORAGE
897  | Fortify_SetAllocateFailRate(int Percent)
898  | {
899  |     int Old = st_AllocateFailRate;
900  |   
901  |     st_AllocateFailRate = Percent;
902  |   
903  |     return (Old);
904  | }
905  | 
906  |  
907  | /*
908  |  * Fortify_CheckAllMemory() - Checks the fortifications
909  |  * of all memory on the allocated list. And, if 
910  |  * FORTIFY_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY is enabled, all the
911  |  * known deallocated memory as well.
912  |  * Returns the number of blocks that failed. 
913  |  * Always returns 0 if Fortify is disabled.
914  |  */
915  | DWORD FORTIFY_STORAGE
916  | Fortify_CheckAllMemory(const char *file, DWORD line)
917  | {
918  |     struct Header *curr = st_AllocatedHead;
919  |     DWORD count = 0;
920  | 
921  |     if (st_Disabled)
922  |         return 0;
923  | 
924  |     FORTIFY_LOCK();
925  | 
926  |     /*
927  |      * Check the allocated memory
928  |      */ 
929  |     while (curr)
930  |     {
931  |         if (!st_CheckBlock(curr, file, line))
932  |         {
933  |           count++;
934  |           break;    // !! added, GV 13/7-98
935  |         }
936  |         curr = curr->Next;      
937  |     }
938  | 
939  |     /*
940  |      * Check the deallocated memory while you're at it
941  |      */
942  | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
943  |     curr = st_DeallocatedHead;
944  |     while (curr)
945  |     {
946  |         if (!st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(curr, file, line))
947  |             count++;
948  | 
949  |         curr = curr->Next;      
950  |     }
951  | #endif    
952  | 
953  |     /*  
954  |      * If we know where we are, and everything is cool,
955  |      * remember that. It might be important.
956  |      */
957  |     if (file && count == 0)
958  |     {
959  |         st_LastVerifiedFile = file;
960  |         st_LastVerifiedLine = line;
961  |     }
962  | 
963  |     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
964  |     return (count);
965  | }
966  | 
967  | 
968  | /*
969  |  * Fortify_EnterScope() - enters a new Fortify scope 
970  |  * level. Returns the new scope level.
971  |  */
972  | BYTE FORTIFY_STORAGE
973  | Fortify_EnterScope(const char *file, DWORD line)
974  | {
975  | //    ARGSUSED (file);
976  | //    ARGSUSED (line);
977  |     return (++st_Scope);
978  | }
979  | 
980  | /* Fortify_LeaveScope - leaves a Fortify scope level,
981  |  * also prints a memory dump of all non-freed memory 
982  |  * that was allocated during the scope being exited.
983  |  * Does nothing and returns 0 if Fortify is disabled.
984  |  */
985  | BYTE FORTIFY_STORAGE
986  | Fortify_LeaveScope(const char *file, DWORD line)
987  | {
988  |     struct Header *curr = st_AllocatedHead;
989  |     DWORD size = 0, count = 0;
990  | 
991  |     if (st_Disabled)
992  |         return 0;
993  | 
994  |     FORTIFY_LOCK();
995  | 
996  |     st_Scope--;
997  |     while (curr)
998  |     {
999  |         if (curr->Scope > st_Scope)
1000 |         {
1001 |             if (count == 0)
1002 |             {
1003 |                 sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Memory leak detected leaving scope at %s.%lu\n", file, line);
1004 |                 st_Output(st_Buffer);
1005 |                 sprintf(st_Buffer, "%10s %8s %s\n", "Address", "Size", "Allocator");
1006 |                 st_Output(st_Buffer);
1007 |             }
1008 |             
1009 |             st_OutputHeader(curr);
1010 |             count++;
1011 |             size += curr->Size;
1012 |         }
1013 | 
1014 |         curr = curr->Next;      
1015 |     }
1016 | 
1017 |     if (count)
1018 |     {
1019 |         sprintf(st_Buffer,"%8s %8lu bytes in %lu blocks with %lu bytes overhead\n",
1020 |                 "total", size, count, count * FORTIFY_OVERHEAD);
1021 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1022 |     }
1023 | 
1024 | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
1025 |     /* 
1026 |      * Quietly free all the deallocated memory 
1027 |      * that was allocated in this scope that 
1028 |      * we are still tracking
1029 |      */
1030 |     st_PurgeDeallocatedScope (st_Scope, file, line);
1031 | #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
1032 | 
1033 |     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
1034 |     return (st_Scope);
1035 | }
1036 | 
1037 | /*
1038 |  * Fortify_ListAllMemory() - Outputs the entire 
1039 |  * list of currently allocated memory. For each block 
1040 |  * is output it's Address, Size, and the SourceFile and 
1041 |  * Line that allocated it.
1042 |  *
1043 |  * If there is no memory on the list, this function 
1044 |  * outputs nothing.
1045 |  *
1046 |  * It returns the number of blocks on the list, unless 
1047 |  * Fortify has been disabled, in which case it always 
1048 |  * returns 0.
1049 |  */
1050 | DWORD FORTIFY_STORAGE
1051 | Fortify_ListAllMemory(const char *file, DWORD line)
1052 | {
1053 |     struct Header *curr = st_AllocatedHead;
1054 |     DWORD size = 0, count = 0;
1055 | 
1056 |     if (st_Disabled)
1057 |         return 0;
1058 | 
1059 |     Fortify_CheckAllMemory(file, line);
1060 | 
1061 |     FORTIFY_LOCK();
1062 | 
1063 |     if (curr)
1064 |     {
1065 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\n\nFortify: Memory List at %s.%lu\n", file, line);
1066 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1067 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "%10s %8s %s\n", "Address", "Size", "Allocator");
1068 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1069 |                                 
1070 |         while (curr)
1071 |         {
1072 |             st_OutputHeader(curr);
1073 |             count++;
1074 |             size += curr->Size;
1075 |             curr = curr->Next;      
1076 |         }
1077 |                      
1078 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "%8s %8lu bytes in %lu blocks and %lu bytes overhead\n",
1079 |                            "total", size, count, count * FORTIFY_OVERHEAD);
1080 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1081 |     }
1082 |   
1083 |     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
1084 |     return (count);
1085 | }
1086 | 
1087 | /*
1088 |  * Fortify_DumpAllMemory() - Outputs the entire list of 
1089 |  * currently allocated memory. For each allocated block 
1090 |  * is output it's Address, Size, the SourceFile and Line
1091 |  * that allocated it, a hex dump of the contents of the 
1092 |  * memory and an ascii dump of printable characters.
1093 |  *
1094 |  * If there is no memory on the list, this function outputs nothing.
1095 |  */
1096 | DWORD FORTIFY_STORAGE
1097 | Fortify_DumpAllMemory(const char *file, DWORD line)
1098 | {
1099 |     struct Header *curr = st_AllocatedHead;
1100 |     DWORD count = 0;
1101 | 
1102 |     if (st_Disabled)
1103 |         return 0;
1104 | 
1105 |     Fortify_CheckAllMemory(file, line);
1106 | 
1107 |     FORTIFY_LOCK();
1108 | 
1109 |     while (curr)
1110 |     {
1111 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Hex Dump of %s at %s.%lu\n",
1112 |                 st_MemoryBlockString(curr), file, line);
1113 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1114 |         st_OutputMemory(curr);
1115 |         st_Output("\n");
1116 |         count++;
1117 | 
1118 |         curr = curr->Next;
1119 |     }
1120 | 
1121 |     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
1122 |     return (count);
1123 | }
1124 | 
1125 | /* Fortify_OutputStatistics() - displays statistics 
1126 |  * about the maximum amount of memory that was 
1127 |  * allocated at any one time.
1128 |  */
1129 | void FORTIFY_STORAGE
1130 | Fortify_OutputStatistics(const char *file, DWORD line)
1131 | {
1132 |     if (st_Disabled)
1133 |         return;
1134 | 
1135 |     sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Statistics at %s.%lu\n", file, line);
1136 |     st_Output(st_Buffer);
1137 | 
1138 |     sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory currently allocated: %lu bytes in %lu blocks\n",
1139 |                                  st_CurAllocation, st_CurBlocks);
1140 |     st_Output(st_Buffer);
1141 |     sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Maximum memory allocated at one time: %lu bytes in %lu blocks\n", 
1142 |                                  st_MaxAllocation, st_MaxBlocks);
1143 |     st_Output(st_Buffer);
1144 |     sprintf(st_Buffer, "         There have been %lu allocations and %lu deallocations\n",
1145 |                                  st_Allocations, st_Frees);
1146 |     st_Output(st_Buffer);
1147 |     sprintf(st_Buffer, "         There was a total of %lu bytes allocated\n",
1148 |                                  st_TotalAllocation);
1149 |     st_Output(st_Buffer);
1150 |     
1151 |     if (st_Allocations > 0)
1152 |     {
1153 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         The average allocation was %lu bytes\n",
1154 |                                      st_TotalAllocation / st_Allocations);
1155 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);                   
1156 |     }    
1157 | }
1158 | 
1159 | /* Fortify_GetCurrentAllocation() - returns the number of
1160 |  * bytes currently allocated.
1161 |  */
1162 | DWORD FORTIFY_STORAGE
1163 | Fortify_GetCurrentAllocation(const char *file, DWORD line)
1164 | {
1165 | //    ARGSUSED (file);
1166 | //    ARGSUSED (line);
1167 | 
1168 |     if (st_Disabled)
1169 |         return 0;
1170 | 
1171 |     return st_CurAllocation;
1172 | }
1173 | 
1174 | /* Fortify_SetAllocationLimit() - set a limit on the total
1175 |  * amount of memory allowed for this application.
1176 |  */
1177 | void FORTIFY_STORAGE
1178 | Fortify_SetAllocationLimit(DWORD NewLimit, const char *file, DWORD line)
1179 | {
1180 | //    ARGSUSED (file);
1181 | //    ARGSUSED (line);
1182 | 
1183 |     st_AllocationLimit = NewLimit;
1184 | }
1185 | 
1186 | /*
1187 |  * Fortify_Disable() - Run time method of disabling Fortify.
1188 |  * Useful if you need to turn off Fortify without recompiling
1189 |  * everything. Not as effective as compiling out, of course.
1190 |  * The less memory allocated by Fortify when it is disabled
1191 |  * the better.
1192 |  * (Previous versions of Fortify did not allow it to be 
1193 |  * disabled if there was any memory allocated at the time,
1194 |  * but since in C++ memory is often allocated before main
1195 |  * is even entered, this was useless so Fortify is now
1196 |  * able to cope).
1197 |  */
1198 | void FORTIFY_STORAGE
1199 | Fortify_Disable(const char *file, DWORD line)
1200 | {
1201 | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
1202 |     /* free all deallocated memory we might be tracking */
1203 |     st_PurgeDeallocatedScope (0, file, line);
1204 | #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
1205 | 
1206 |     st_Disabled = 1;
1207 | }
1208 | 
1209 | 
1210 | 
1211 | /*
1212 |  * st_CheckBlock - Check a block's header and fortifications.
1213 |  * Returns true if the block is happy.
1214 |  */
1215 | STATIC int
1216 | st_CheckBlock(struct Header *h, const char *file, DWORD line)
1217 | {
1218 |     BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)h;
1219 |     int result = 1;
1220 | 
1221 |     if (!st_IsHeaderValid(h))
1222 |     {
1223 |       sprintf (st_Buffer,
1224 |                "\nFortify: Invalid pointer (%08lX) or corrupted header detected at %s.%lu\n",
1225 |                (DWORD)(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE), file, line);
1226 |                 
1227 |       st_Output (st_Buffer);
1228 |       st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
1229 |       return (0);
1230 |     }
1231 | 
1232 |     if (!st_CheckFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE,
1233 |                            FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE))
1234 |     {
1235 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Underwrite detected before block %s at %s.%lu\n",
1236 |                            st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
1237 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1238 | 
1239 |         st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
1240 |         st_OutputFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE,
1241 |                             FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
1242 |         result = 0;                        
1243 | 
1244 | #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION
1245 |         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE, FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
1246 | #endif
1247 |     }
1248 |                            
1249 |     if (!st_CheckFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
1250 |                            FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE))
1251 |     {
1252 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Overwrite detected after block %s at %s.%lu\n",
1253 |                            st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
1254 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1255 | 
1256 |         st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
1257 |         st_OutputFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
1258 |                             FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
1259 |         result = 0;
1260 | 
1261 | #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION
1262 |         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
1263 |                          FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
1264 | #endif
1265 |     }
1266 |  
1267 |     return (result);
1268 | }
1269 | 
1270 | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
1271 | 
1272 | /* 
1273 |  * st_CheckDeallocatedBlock - Check a deallocated block's header and fortifications.
1274 |  * Returns true if the block is happy.
1275 |  */
1276 | STATIC int
1277 | st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(struct Header *h, const char *file, DWORD line)
1278 | {
1279 |     BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)h;
1280 |     int result = 1;
1281 | 
1282 |     if (!st_IsHeaderValid(h))
1283 |     {
1284 |       sprintf (st_Buffer,
1285 |                "\nFortify: Invalid deallocated pointer (%08lX) or corrupted header detected at %s.%lu\n",
1286 |                (DWORD)(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE), file, line);
1287 |                 
1288 |       st_Output(st_Buffer);
1289 |       st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
1290 |       return (0);
1291 |     }
1292 | 
1293 |     if (!st_CheckFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE,
1294 |             FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE))
1295 |     {
1296 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Underwrite detected before deallocated block %s at %s.%lu\n",
1297 |                            st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
1298 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1299 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
1300 |                            st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
1301 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1302 | 
1303 |         st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
1304 |         st_OutputFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE,
1305 |                             FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
1306 | 
1307 | #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION
1308 |         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE, FORTIFY_BEFORE_VALUE, FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE);
1309 | #endif
1310 |         result = 0;
1311 |     }
1312 |                            
1313 |     if (!st_CheckFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
1314 |                            FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE))
1315 |     {
1316 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Overwrite detected after deallocated block %s at %s.%lu\n",
1317 |                            st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
1318 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1319 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
1320 |                            st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
1321 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1322 | 
1323 |         st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
1324 |         st_OutputFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
1325 |                             FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
1326 | 
1327 | #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION
1328 |         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size,
1329 |                          FORTIFY_AFTER_VALUE, FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
1330 | #endif
1331 |         result = 0;
1332 |     }
1333 | 
1334 | #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE
1335 |     if (!st_CheckFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
1336 |                            FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE, h->Size))
1337 |     {
1338 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Write to deallocated block %s detected at %s.%lu\n",
1339 |                            st_MemoryBlockString(h), file, line);
1340 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1341 | 
1342 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory block was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
1343 |                            st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
1344 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1345 |         st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint();
1346 |     
1347 |         st_OutputFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
1348 |                             FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE, h->Size);
1349 | 
1350 | #ifdef FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION
1351 |         st_SetFortification(ptr + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
1352 |                             FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE, h->Size);
1353 | #endif /* FORTIFY_FILL_ON_CORRUPTION */
1354 |         result = 0;
1355 |     }
1356 | #endif /* FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE */
1357 |     return result;
1358 |  }
1359 | 
1360 | #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
1361 | 
1362 | 
1363 | /*
1364 |  * st_CheckFortification - Checks if the _size_ 
1365 |  * bytes from _ptr_ are all set to _value_
1366 |  * Returns true if all is happy.
1367 |  */
1368 | STATIC int
1369 | st_CheckFortification(BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size)
1370 | {
1371 |     while (size--)
1372 |         if (*ptr++ != value)
1373 |             return (0);
1374 |       
1375 |     return (1);
1376 | }
1377 | 
1378 | /*
1379 |  * st_SetFortification - Set the _size_ bytes from _ptr_ to _value_.
1380 |  */
1381 | STATIC void
1382 | st_SetFortification(BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size)
1383 | {
1384 |     memset(ptr, value, size);
1385 | }
1386 | 
1387 | /*
1388 |  * st_OutputFortification - Output the corrupted section of the fortification 
1389 |  */
1390 | STATIC void
1391 | st_OutputFortification(BYTE *ptr, BYTE value, size_t size)
1392 | {
1393 |     size_t offset, skipped, advance;
1394 |     offset = 0;
1395 | 
1396 |     sprintf(st_Buffer, "   Address   Offset Data (%02x)", value);
1397 |     st_Output(st_Buffer);
1398 | 
1399 |     while (offset < size)
1400 |     {
1401 |         /* 
1402 |          * Skip 3 or more 'correct' lines
1403 |          */
1404 |         if ((size - offset) < 3 * 16)
1405 |             advance = size - offset;
1406 |         else
1407 |             advance = 3 * 16;
1408 |         if (advance > 0 && st_CheckFortification(ptr+offset, value, advance))
1409 |         {
1410 |             offset += advance;
1411 |             skipped = advance;
1412 |                  
1413 |             if (size - offset < 16)
1414 |                 advance = size - offset;
1415 |             else
1416 |                 advance = 16;
1417 |              
1418 |             while (advance > 0 && st_CheckFortification(ptr+offset, value, advance))
1419 |             {
1420 |                 offset  += advance;
1421 |                 skipped += advance;
1422 |                 if (size - offset < 16)
1423 |                     advance = size - offset;
1424 |                 else
1425 |                     advance = 16;
1426 |             }    
1427 |             sprintf(st_Buffer, "\n                        ...%lu bytes skipped...", (DWORD)skipped);
1428 |             st_Output(st_Buffer);
1429 |             continue;
1430 |         }
1431 |         else
1432 |         {
1433 |             if (size - offset < 16)
1434 |                 st_HexDump(ptr, offset, size-offset, 0);
1435 |             else
1436 |                 st_HexDump(ptr, offset, 16, 0);
1437 |                 
1438 |             offset += 16;
1439 |         }
1440 |     }
1441 | 
1442 |     st_Output("\n");
1443 | }
1444 | 
1445 | /*
1446 |  * st_HexDump - output a nice hex dump of "size" bytes, starting at "ptr" + "offset"
1447 |  */
1448 | STATIC void
1449 | st_HexDump(BYTE *ptr, size_t offset, size_t size, int title)
1450 | {
1451 |     char ascii[17];
1452 |     int  column;
1453 |     int  output;
1454 | 
1455 |     if (title)
1456 |         st_Output("   Address   Offset Data");
1457 | 
1458 |     column = 0;
1459 |     ptr += offset;
1460 |     output = 0;
1461 | 
1462 |     while (output < size)
1463 |     {
1464 |         if (column == 0)
1465 |         {
1466 |           sprintf(st_Buffer, "\n%08lX %8lu ", (DWORD)ptr, (DWORD)offset);
1467 |           st_Output(st_Buffer);
1468 |         }
1469 | 
1470 |         sprintf (st_Buffer, "%02x%s", *ptr, ((column % 4) == 3) ? " " : "");
1471 |         st_Output (st_Buffer);
1472 | 
1473 |         ascii [column]   = isprint(*ptr) ? (char)*ptr : '.';
1474 |         ascii [column+1] = '\0';
1475 | 
1476 |         ptr++;
1477 |         offset++;
1478 |         output++;
1479 |         column++;
1480 | 
1481 |         if (column == 16)
1482 |         {
1483 |             st_Output ("   \"");
1484 |             st_Output (ascii);
1485 |             st_Output ("\"");
1486 |             column = 0;
1487 |         }
1488 |     }
1489 | 
1490 |     if  (column != 0)
1491 |     {
1492 |         while  (column < 16)
1493 |         {
1494 |             if  (column % 4 == 3)
1495 |                 st_Output ("   ");
1496 |             else
1497 |                 st_Output ("  ");
1498 | 
1499 |             column++;
1500 |         }
1501 |         st_Output ("   \"");
1502 |         st_Output (ascii);
1503 |         st_Output ("\"");
1504 |     }
1505 | }
1506 | 
1507 | /*
1508 |  * st_IsHeaderValid - Returns true if the 
1509 |  * supplied pointer does indeed point to a 
1510 |  * real Header
1511 |  */
1512 | STATIC int
1513 | st_IsHeaderValid(struct Header *h)                                
1514 | {
1515 |     return (st_ChecksumHeader(h) == FORTIFY_CHECKSUM_VALUE);
1516 | }
1517 | 
1518 | /*
1519 |  * st_MakeHeaderValid - Updates the checksum 
1520 |  * to make the header valid
1521 |  */
1522 | STATIC void
1523 | st_MakeHeaderValid(struct Header *h)
1524 | {
1525 |     h->Checksum = 0;
1526 |     h->Checksum = (WORD)(FORTIFY_CHECKSUM_VALUE - st_ChecksumHeader(h));
1527 | }
1528 | 
1529 | /*
1530 |  * st_ChecksumHeader - Calculate (and return) 
1531 |  * the checksum of the header. (Including the 
1532 |  * Checksum field itself. If all is well, the 
1533 |  * checksum returned by this function should
1534 |  * be FORTIFY_CHECKSUM_VALUE
1535 |  */
1536 | STATIC WORD
1537 | st_ChecksumHeader(struct Header *h)
1538 | {
1539 | #if defined(USE_FAST_CKSUM)
1540 |     return inchksum_fast (h, FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE/sizeof(WORD));
1541 | #else
1542 |     WORD c, checksum, *p;
1543 |   
1544 |     for(c = 0, checksum = 0, p = (WORD *)h;
1545 |         c < FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE/sizeof(WORD); c++)
1546 |     {    
1547 |         checksum += *p++;  
1548 |     }    
1549 |     
1550 |     return (checksum);
1551 | #endif
1552 | }                  
1553 | 
1554 | /* 
1555 |  * st_IsOnAllocatedList - Examines the allocated 
1556 |  * list to see if the given header is on it.
1557 |  */  
1558 | STATIC int
1559 | st_IsOnAllocatedList(struct Header *h)
1560 | {
1561 |     struct Header *curr;
1562 |   
1563 |     curr = st_AllocatedHead;
1564 |     while (curr)
1565 |     {
1566 |         if (curr == h)
1567 |             return (1);
1568 |       
1569 |         curr = curr->Next;
1570 |     }
1571 |   
1572 |     return (0);
1573 | }
1574 | 
1575 | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
1576 | /* 
1577 |  * st_IsOnDeallocatedList - Examines the deallocated 
1578 |  * list to see if the given header is on it.
1579 |  */  
1580 | STATIC int
1581 | st_IsOnDeallocatedList(struct Header *h)
1582 | {
1583 |     struct Header *curr;
1584 |   
1585 |     curr = st_DeallocatedHead;
1586 |     while (curr)
1587 |     {
1588 |         if (curr == h)
1589 |             return (1);
1590 |       
1591 |         curr = curr->Next;
1592 |     }
1593 |   
1594 |     return (0);
1595 | }
1596 | 
1597 | /*
1598 |  * st_PurgeDeallocatedBlocks - free at least "Bytes"
1599 |  * worth of deallocated memory, starting at the 
1600 |  * oldest deallocated block.
1601 |  * Returns true if any blocks were freed.
1602 |  */
1603 | STATIC int
1604 | st_PurgeDeallocatedBlocks(DWORD Bytes, const char *file, DWORD line)
1605 | {
1606 |     DWORD FreedBytes = 0;
1607 |     DWORD FreedBlocks = 0;
1608 | 
1609 | #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
1610 |     sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Warning - Discarding deallocated memory at %s.%lu\n", 
1611 |                        file, line);
1612 |     st_Output(st_Buffer);
1613 | #endif /* FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
1614 | 
1615 |     while (st_DeallocatedTail && FreedBytes < Bytes)
1616 |     {
1617 |         st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(st_DeallocatedTail, file, line);
1618 |         FreedBytes += st_DeallocatedTail->Size;
1619 |         FreedBlocks++;
1620 | #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
1621 | #ifdef FORTIFY_VERBOSE_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
1622 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "                %s\n",
1623 |                            st_DeallocatedMemoryBlockString(st_DeallocatedTail));
1624 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
1625 | #endif /* FORTIFY_VERBOSE_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
1626 | #endif /* FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
1627 |         st_FreeDeallocatedBlock(st_DeallocatedTail, file, line);
1628 |     }
1629 | 
1630 |     return FreedBlocks != 0;
1631 | }
1632 | 
1633 | /*
1634 |  * st_PurgeDeallocatedScope - free all deallocated
1635 |  * memory blocks that were allocated within "Scope"
1636 |  */
1637 | STATIC int
1638 | st_PurgeDeallocatedScope(BYTE Scope, const char *file, DWORD line)
1639 | {
1640 |     struct Header *curr;
1641 |     DWORD FreedBlocks = 0;
1642 | 
1643 |     curr = st_DeallocatedHead;
1644 |     while (curr)
1645 |     {
1646 |         struct Header *next = curr->Next;
1647 |         if (curr->Scope >= Scope)
1648 |         {
1649 |             st_FreeDeallocatedBlock(curr, file, line);
1650 |             FreedBlocks++;
1651 |         }
1652 | 
1653 |         curr = next;
1654 |     }
1655 |     
1656 |     return FreedBlocks != 0;
1657 | }
1658 | 
1659 | /*
1660 |  * st_FreeDeallocatedBlock - actually remove
1661 |  * a deallocated block from the deallocated 
1662 |  * list, and actually free it's memory.
1663 |  */
1664 | STATIC void
1665 | st_FreeDeallocatedBlock(struct Header *h, const char *file, DWORD line)
1666 | {
1667 |     st_CheckDeallocatedBlock (h, file, line);
1668 | 
1669 |    /* 
1670 |     * Begin Critical region 
1671 |     */
1672 |     FORTIFY_LOCK();
1673 | 
1674 |     st_TotalDeallocated -= h->Size;
1675 |     
1676 |     if (st_DeallocatedHead == h)
1677 |     {
1678 |         st_DeallocatedHead = h->Next;
1679 |     }
1680 |     
1681 |     if (st_DeallocatedTail == h)
1682 |     {
1683 |         st_DeallocatedTail = h->Prev;
1684 |     }
1685 |     
1686 |     if (h->Prev)
1687 |     {
1688 |         st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(h->Prev, file, line);
1689 |         h->Prev->Next = h->Next;
1690 |         st_MakeHeaderValid(h->Prev);    
1691 |     }
1692 |     
1693 |     if (h->Next)
1694 |     {
1695 |         st_CheckDeallocatedBlock(h->Next, file, line);
1696 |         h->Next->Prev = h->Prev;
1697 |         st_MakeHeaderValid(h->Next);    
1698 |     }
1699 | 
1700 |     /*
1701 |      * Free the label
1702 |      */
1703 |     if (h->Label)
1704 |     {
1705 |         free(h->Label);
1706 |     }
1707 | 
1708 |     /*
1709 |      * Nuke out all memory that is about to be freed, including the header
1710 |      */
1711 |     st_SetFortification((BYTE*)h, FORTIFY_FILL_ON_DEALLOCATE_VALUE,
1712 |                         FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE + h->Size + FORTIFY_AFTER_SIZE);
1713 | 
1714 |     /*
1715 |      * And do the actual free
1716 |      */
1717 |     free(h);
1718 |     
1719 |     /*
1720 |      * End critical region
1721 |      */
1722 |     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();    
1723 | }
1724 | 
1725 | #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
1726 | 
1727 | /*
1728 |  * st_OutputMemory - Hex and ascii dump the 
1729 |  * user memory of a block.
1730 |  */
1731 | STATIC void
1732 | st_OutputMemory(struct Header *h)
1733 | {
1734 |     st_HexDump((BYTE*)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
1735 |                0, h->Size, 1);
1736 | }
1737 | 
1738 | 
1739 | /*
1740 |  * st_OutputHeader - Output the header
1741 |  */
1742 | STATIC void st_OutputHeader (struct Header *h)
1743 | {
1744 |   BYTE *adr = (BYTE*)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE;
1745 | 
1746 |   if (h->Label == NULL)
1747 |        sprintf (st_Buffer, "%08lX %8lu %s.%lu\n",
1748 |                 (DWORD) adr, (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line);
1749 | 
1750 |   else sprintf (st_Buffer, "%08lX %8lu %s.%lu %s\n",
1751 |                 (DWORD) adr, (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line, h->Label);
1752 |   st_Output(st_Buffer);
1753 | }
1754 | 
1755 | /*
1756 |  * st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint - output the last
1757 |  * known point where everything was hoopy.
1758 |  */
1759 | STATIC void
1760 | st_OutputLastVerifiedPoint()
1761 | {
1762 |     sprintf(st_Buffer, "         Memory integrity was last verified at %s.%lu\n", 
1763 |                        st_LastVerifiedFile,
1764 |                        st_LastVerifiedLine);
1765 |     st_Output(st_Buffer);
1766 | }
1767 | 
1768 | /*
1769 |  * st_MemoryBlockString - constructs a string that 
1770 |  * desribes a memory block. (pointer,size,allocator,label)
1771 |  */
1772 | STATIC const char *
1773 | st_MemoryBlockString(struct Header *h)
1774 | {
1775 |     static char st_BlockString[512];
1776 |     
1777 |     if (h->Label == 0)
1778 |     {
1779 |         sprintf (st_BlockString,"(%08lX,%lu,%s.%lu)",
1780 |                 (DWORD)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
1781 |                 (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line);
1782 |     }            
1783 |     else
1784 |     {
1785 |         sprintf(st_BlockString,"(%08lX,%lu,%s.%lu,%s)",
1786 |                 (DWORD)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
1787 |                 (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line, h->Label);
1788 |     }
1789 | 
1790 |     return st_BlockString;
1791 | }
1792 | 
1793 | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
1794 | #ifdef FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
1795 | #ifdef FORTIFY_VERBOSE_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
1796 | /*
1797 |  * st_DeallocatedMemoryBlockString - constructs
1798 |  * a string that desribes a deallocated memory
1799 |  * block. (pointer,size,allocator,deallocator)
1800 |  */
1801 | 
1802 | STATIC const char *
1803 | st_DeallocatedMemoryBlockString(struct Header *h)
1804 | {
1805 |     static char st_BlockString[256];
1806 | 
1807 |     if (h->Label == 0)
1808 |     {
1809 |         sprintf(st_BlockString,"(%08lX,%lu,%s.%lu,%s.%lu)",
1810 |                 (DWORD)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
1811 |                 (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line, h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
1812 |     }            
1813 |     else
1814 |     {
1815 |         sprintf(st_BlockString,"(%08lX,%lu,%s.%lu,%s.%lu,%s)",
1816 |                 (DWORD)h + FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE + FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE,
1817 |                 (DWORD)h->Size, h->File, h->Line, h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine, h->Label);
1818 |     }
1819 | 
1820 |     return st_BlockString;
1821 | }
1822 | #endif /* FORTIFY_VERBOSE_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
1823 | #endif /* FORTIFY_WARN_WHEN_DISCARDING_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
1824 | #endif /* FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY */
1825 | 
1826 | 
1827 | /*
1828 |  * st_DefaultOutput - the default output function
1829 |  */
1830 | STATIC void
1831 | st_DefaultOutput(const char *String)
1832 | {
1833 |     fprintf(stdout, String);
1834 |     fflush(stdout);
1835 | }
1836 | 
1837 | /*
1838 |  * Fortify_malloc - Fortify's replacement malloc()
1839 |  */
1840 | void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
1841 | Fortify_malloc(size_t size, const char *file, DWORD line)
1842 | {
1843 |     return Fortify_Allocate(size, Fortify_Allocator_malloc, file, line);
1844 | }
1845 | 
1846 | /*
1847 |  * Fortify_realloc - Fortify's replacement realloc()
1848 |  */
1849 | void *
1850 | Fortify_realloc(void *uptr, size_t new_size, const char *file, DWORD line)
1851 | {
1852 |     BYTE *ptr = (BYTE *)uptr - FORTIFY_HEADER_SIZE - FORTIFY_ALIGNED_BEFORE_SIZE;
1853 |     struct Header *h = (struct Header *)ptr;
1854 |     void *new_ptr;
1855 | 
1856 |     /*
1857 |      * If Fortify is disabled, we gotta do this a little 
1858 |      * differently.
1859 |      */
1860 |     if (!st_Disabled)
1861 |     {
1862 |         if (!uptr)
1863 |             return (Fortify_Allocate(new_size, Fortify_Allocator_realloc, file, line));
1864 |         
1865 |         if (!st_IsOnAllocatedList(h))
1866 |         {
1867 | #ifdef FORTIFY_TRACK_DEALLOCATED_MEMORY
1868 |             if (st_IsOnDeallocatedList(h))
1869 |             {
1870 |                 sprintf(st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Deallocated memory block passed to \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
1871 |                                     st_AllocatorName[Fortify_Allocator_realloc], file, line);
1872 |                 st_Output(st_Buffer);
1873 |                 sprintf(st_Buffer,   "         Memory block %s was deallocated by \"%s\" at %s.%lu\n",
1874 |                                    st_MemoryBlockString(h),
1875 |                                    st_DeallocatorName[h->Deallocator], h->FreedFile, h->FreedLine);
1876 |                 st_Output(st_Buffer);
1877 |                 return 0;
1878 |             }
1879 | #endif
1880 | 
1881 | 
1882 |             sprintf (st_Buffer, "\nFortify: Invalid pointer (%08lX) passed to realloc at %s.%lu\n",
1883 |                      (DWORD)ptr, file, line);
1884 | 
1885 |             st_Output(st_Buffer);
1886 |             return 0;
1887 |         }
1888 | 
1889 |         if (!st_CheckBlock(h, file, line))
1890 |             return 0;
1891 |       
1892 |         new_ptr = Fortify_Allocate(new_size, Fortify_Allocator_realloc, file, line);
1893 |         if (!new_ptr)
1894 |         {
1895 |             return (0);
1896 |         }
1897 |       
1898 |         if (h->Size < new_size)
1899 |             memcpy(new_ptr, uptr, h->Size);
1900 |         else
1901 |             memcpy(new_ptr, uptr, new_size);
1902 |     
1903 |         Fortify_Deallocate(uptr, Fortify_Deallocator_realloc, file, line);
1904 |         return (new_ptr);
1905 |     }
1906 |     else
1907 |     {
1908 |         /*
1909 |          * If the old block was fortified, we can't use normal realloc.
1910 |          */
1911 |         if (st_IsOnAllocatedList(h))
1912 |         {
1913 |             new_ptr = Fortify_Allocate(new_size, Fortify_Allocator_realloc, file, line);
1914 |             if (!new_ptr)
1915 |                 return (0);
1916 |           
1917 |             if (h->Size < new_size)
1918 |                 memcpy(new_ptr, uptr, h->Size);
1919 |             else
1920 |                 memcpy(new_ptr, uptr, new_size);
1921 |         
1922 |             Fortify_Deallocate(uptr, Fortify_Deallocator_realloc, file, line);
1923 |             return (new_ptr);
1924 |         }
1925 |         else /* easy */
1926 |         {
1927 |             return realloc(uptr, new_size);
1928 |         }
1929 |     }
1930 | }
1931 | 
1932 | /*
1933 |  * Fortify_calloc - Fortify's replacement calloc
1934 |  */
1935 | void *
1936 | Fortify_calloc(size_t num, size_t size, const char *file, DWORD line)
1937 | {
1938 |     if (!st_Disabled)
1939 |     {
1940 |         void *ptr = Fortify_Allocate(size * num, Fortify_Allocator_calloc, file, line);
1941 |         if (ptr)
1942 |         {
1943 |             memset(ptr, 0, size*num);
1944 |         }
1945 |         return ptr;
1946 |     }    
1947 |     else
1948 |     {
1949 |         return calloc(num, size);
1950 |     }
1951 | }
1952 | 
1953 | /*
1954 |  * Fortify_free - Fortify's replacement free
1955 |  */
1956 | void  
1957 | Fortify_free(void *uptr, const char *file, DWORD line)
1958 | {
1959 |     /* it is defined to be safe to free(0) */
1960 |     if (uptr == 0)
1961 |         return;
1962 | 
1963 |     Fortify_Deallocate(uptr, Fortify_Deallocator_free, file, line);
1964 | }
1965 | 
1966 | /*
1967 |  * Fortify_strdup - Fortify's replacement strdup. Since strdup isn't
1968 |  * ANSI, it is only provided if FORTIFY_STRDUP is defined.
1969 |  */
1970 | #ifdef FORTIFY_STRDUP
1971 | char *FORTIFY_STORAGE
1972 | Fortify_strdup(const char *oldStr, const char *file, DWORD line)
1973 | {
1974 |     if (!st_Disabled)
1975 |     {
1976 |         char *newStr = Fortify_Allocate(strlen(oldStr)+1, Fortify_Allocator_strdup, file, line);
1977 |         if (newStr)
1978 |         {
1979 |             strcpy(newStr, oldStr);
1980 |         }
1981 |     
1982 |         return newStr;
1983 |     }    
1984 |     else
1985 |     {
1986 |         return strdup(oldStr);
1987 |     }
1988 | }
1989 | #endif /* FORTIFY_STRDUP */
1990 | 
1991 | STATIC void st_OutputDeleteTrace (void)
1992 | {
1993 | #ifdef __cplusplus
1994 |   if (st_DeleteStackTop > 1)
1995 |   {
1996 |     sprintf(st_Buffer, "Delete Trace: %s.%lu\n", st_DeleteFile[st_DeleteStackTop-1],
1997 |                                                  st_DeleteLine[st_DeleteStackTop-1]);
1998 |     st_Output(st_Buffer);
1999 |     for(int c = st_DeleteStackTop-2; c >= 0; c--)
2000 |     {
2001 |         sprintf(st_Buffer, "              %s.%lu\n", st_DeleteFile[c],
2002 |                                                      st_DeleteLine[c]);
2003 |         st_Output(st_Buffer);
2004 |     }
2005 |   }
2006 | #endif
2007 | }
2008 | 
2009 | #ifdef __cplusplus
2010 | 
2011 | /*
2012 |  * st_NewHandler() - there is no easy way to get
2013 |  * the new handler function. And isn't it great
2014 |  * how the new handler doesn't take a parameter
2015 |  * giving the size of the request that failed.
2016 |  * Thanks Bjarne!
2017 |  */
2018 | Fortify_NewHandlerFunc
2019 | st_NewHandler()
2020 | {
2021 |     /* get the current handler */
2022 |     Fortify_NewHandlerFunc handler = set_new_handler(0);
2023 | 
2024 |     /* and set it back (since we cant 
2025 |      * get it without changing it)
2026 |      */
2027 |     set_new_handler(handler);
2028 |     
2029 |     return handler;
2030 | }
2031 | 
2032 | /*
2033 |  * operator new - Fortify's replacement new, 
2034 |  * without source-code information.
2035 |  */
2036 | void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
2037 | operator new(size_t size)
2038 | {
2039 |     void *p;
2040 |     
2041 |     while ((p = Fortify_Allocate(size, Fortify_Allocator_new,
2042 |                                 st_AllocatorName[Fortify_Allocator_new], 0)) == 0)
2043 |     {                            
2044 |         if (st_NewHandler())
2045 |             (*st_NewHandler())();
2046 |         else
2047 |             return 0;
2048 |     }
2049 | 
2050 |     return p;
2051 | }
2052 | 
2053 | /*
2054 |  * operator new - Fortify's replacement new,
2055 |  * with source-code information
2056 |  */
2057 | void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
2058 | operator new(size_t size, const char *file, DWORD line)
2059 | {
2060 |     void *p;
2061 | 
2062 |     while ((p = Fortify_Allocate(size, Fortify_Allocator_new, file, line)) == 0)
2063 |     {
2064 |         if (st_NewHandler())
2065 |             (*st_NewHandler())();
2066 |         else
2067 |             return 0;
2068 |     }
2069 |     
2070 |     return p;
2071 | }
2072 | 
2073 | #ifdef FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_NEW
2074 | 
2075 | /*
2076 |  * operator new[], without source-code info
2077 |  */
2078 | void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
2079 | operator new[](size_t size) 
2080 | {
2081 |     void *p;
2082 | 
2083 |     while ((p = Fortify_Allocate(size, Fortify_Allocator_array_new,
2084 |                                 st_AllocatorName[Fortify_Allocator_array_new], 0)) == 0)
2085 |     {                                
2086 |         if (st_NewHandler())
2087 |             (*st_NewHandler())();    
2088 |         else    
2089 |             return 0;
2090 |     }
2091 |     
2092 |     return p;
2093 | }
2094 | 
2095 | /*
2096 |  * operator new[], with source-code info
2097 |  */
2098 | void *FORTIFY_STORAGE
2099 | operator new[](size_t size, const char *file, DWORD line)
2100 | {
2101 |     void *p;
2102 | 
2103 |     while ((p = Fortify_Allocate(size, Fortify_Allocator_array_new, file, line)) == 0)
2104 |     {
2105 |         if (st_NewHandler())
2106 |             (*st_NewHandler())(); 
2107 |         else
2108 |             return 0;
2109 |     }
2110 | 
2111 |     return p;
2112 | }
2113 | 
2114 | #endif /* FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_NEW */
2115 | 
2116 | /*
2117 |  * Fortify_PreDelete - C++ does not allow overloading
2118 |  * of delete, so the delete macro calls Fortify_PreDelete
2119 |  * with the source-code info, and then calls delete.
2120 |  */
2121 | void FORTIFY_STORAGE
2122 | Fortify_PreDelete(const char *file, DWORD line)
2123 | {
2124 |     FORTIFY_LOCK();
2125 | 
2126 |     /*
2127 |      * Push the source code info for the delete onto the delete stack
2128 |      * (if we have enough room, of course)
2129 |      */
2130 |     if (st_DeleteStackTop < FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE)
2131 |     {
2132 |         st_DeleteFile[st_DeleteStackTop] = file;
2133 |         st_DeleteLine[st_DeleteStackTop] = line;
2134 |     }
2135 | 
2136 |     st_DeleteStackTop++;
2137 | }
2138 | 
2139 | /*
2140 |  * Fortify_PostDelete() - Pop the delete source-code info
2141 |  * off the source stack.
2142 |  */
2143 | void FORTIFY_STORAGE
2144 | Fortify_PostDelete()
2145 | {
2146 |     st_DeleteStackTop--;
2147 | 
2148 |     FORTIFY_UNLOCK();
2149 | }
2150 | 
2151 | /*
2152 |  * operator delete - fortify's replacement delete
2153 |  */
2154 | void FORTIFY_STORAGE
2155 | operator delete(void *uptr)
2156 | {
2157 |     const char *file;
2158 |     DWORD line;
2159 | 
2160 |      /*
2161 |       * It is defined to be harmless to delete 0
2162 |       */
2163 |     if (uptr == 0)
2164 |         return;
2165 | 
2166 |     /*
2167 |      * find the source-code info
2168 |      */
2169 |     if (st_DeleteStackTop)
2170 |     {
2171 |         if (st_DeleteStackTop < FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE)
2172 |         {
2173 |             file = st_DeleteFile[st_DeleteStackTop-1];
2174 |             line = st_DeleteLine[st_DeleteStackTop-1];
2175 |         }
2176 |         else
2177 |         {
2178 |             file = st_DeleteFile[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE-1];
2179 |             line = st_DeleteLine[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE-1];
2180 |         }
2181 |     }
2182 |     else
2183 |     {
2184 |         file = st_DeallocatorName[Fortify_Deallocator_delete];
2185 |         line = 0;
2186 |     }
2187 | 
2188 |     Fortify_Deallocate(uptr, Fortify_Deallocator_delete, file, line);
2189 | }
2190 | 
2191 | #ifdef FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_DELETE
2192 | 
2193 | /*
2194 |  * operator delete[] - fortify's replacement delete[]
2195 |  */
2196 | void FORTIFY_STORAGE
2197 | operator delete[](void *uptr)
2198 | {
2199 |     const char *file;
2200 |     DWORD line;
2201 | 
2202 |      /*
2203 |       * It is defined to be harmless to delete 0
2204 |       */
2205 |     if (uptr == 0)
2206 |         return;
2207 | 
2208 |     /*
2209 |      * find the source-code info
2210 |      */
2211 |     if (st_DeleteStackTop)
2212 |     {
2213 |         if (st_DeleteStackTop < FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE)
2214 |         {
2215 |             file = st_DeleteFile[st_DeleteStackTop-1];
2216 |             line = st_DeleteLine[st_DeleteStackTop-1];
2217 |         }
2218 |         else
2219 |         {
2220 |             file = st_DeleteFile[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE-1];
2221 |             line = st_DeleteLine[FORTIFY_DELETE_STACK_SIZE-1];
2222 |         }
2223 |     }
2224 |     else
2225 |     {
2226 |         file = st_DeallocatorName[Fortify_Deallocator_array_delete];
2227 |         line = 0;
2228 |     }
2229 | 
2230 |     Fortify_Deallocate(uptr, Fortify_Deallocator_array_delete, file, line);
2231 | }
2232 | 
2233 | #endif /* FORTIFY_PROVIDE_ARRAY_DELETE */
2234 | 
2235 | #ifdef FORTIFY_AUTOMATIC_LOG_FILE
2236 | /* Automatic log file stuff!
2237 |  *
2238 |  * AutoLogFile class. There can only ever be ONE of these
2239 |  * instantiated! It is a static class, which means that
2240 |  * it's constructor will be called at program initialization,
2241 |  * and it's destructor will be called at program termination.
2242 |  * We don't know if the other static class objects have been
2243 |  * constructed/destructed yet, but this pretty much the best
2244 |  * we can do with standard C++ language features.
2245 |  */
2246 | class Fortify_AutoLogFile
2247 | {
2248 |     static FILE *fp;
2249 |     static int   written_something;
2250 |     static char *init_string, *term_string;
2251 | 
2252 | public:
2253 |     Fortify_AutoLogFile()
2254 |     {
2255 |         written_something = 0;
2256 |         Fortify_SetOutputFunc(Fortify_AutoLogFile::Output);
2257 |         Fortify_EnterScope(init_string, 0);
2258 |     }
2259 | 
2260 |     static void Output(const char *s)
2261 |     {
2262 |         if (written_something == 0)
2263 |         {
2264 |             FORTIFY_FIRST_ERROR_FUNCTION;
2265 |             fp = fopen(FORTIFY_LOG_FILENAME, "w");
2266 |             if (fp)
2267 |             {
2268 |                 time_t t;
2269 |                 time(&t);
2270 |                 fprintf(fp, "Fortify log started at %s\n", ctime(&t));
2271 |                 written_something = 1;
2272 |             }    
2273 |         }
2274 | 
2275 |         if (fp)
2276 |         {
2277 |             fputs(s, fp);
2278 |             fflush(fp);
2279 |         }    
2280 |     }
2281 |     
2282 |     ~Fortify_AutoLogFile()
2283 |     {
2284 |         Fortify_LeaveScope(term_string, 0);
2285 |         Fortify_CheckAllMemory(term_string, 0);
2286 |         if (fp)
2287 |         {
2288 |             time_t t;
2289 |             time(&t);
2290 |             fprintf(fp, "\nFortify log closed at %s\n", ctime(&t));
2291 |             fclose(fp);
2292 |             fp = 0;
2293 |         }    
2294 |     }
2295 | };
2296 | 
2297 | FILE *Fortify_AutoLogFile::fp = 0;
2298 | int   Fortify_AutoLogFile::written_something = 0;
2299 | char *Fortify_AutoLogFile::init_string = "Program Initialization";
2300 | char *Fortify_AutoLogFile::term_string = "Program Termination";
2301 | 
2302 | static Fortify_AutoLogFile Abracadabra;
2303 | 
2304 | #endif /* FORTIFY_AUTOMATIC_LOG_FILE */
2305 | 
2306 | #endif /* __cplusplus */
2307 | 
2308 | #endif /* USE_FORTIFY || USE_BSD_FORTIFY */
